page.title: 15DAY IN THE LIFE OF AN ADULT
page.content: Thursday 21st June 1985: We are not very good at getting up,today is no exception,Geoff usually rises first and leaves before the rest of us. He knows better than to expect too much of me in the morning-so do the boys. They still need chasing in the morning but know better to try my patience before I've had my coffee. At 8.45 there's just time to put the washing machine on before we pile into the car for the short trip (grey skies - might rain) to school. This provides the first opportunity for socialising, twenty minutes gossip outside the school gates. Thursday is supermarket day,two hours of battling with the shopping trolley to stock up the larder and freezer for the week.Time to collect David,he has spent the morning at school-getting a feel for it.Over lunch we talk over..
